contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox scientist | name = Jaan Einasto | image = Jaan Einasto Marcel Grossmanni preemiaga.jpg | caption = Jaan Einasto with his Marcel Grossmann Award, 2009 | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1929|2|23|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Tartu]], [[Estonia]] | death_date = | death_place = }} '''Jaan Einasto''' (born 23 February 1929 in [[Tartu]]) is an eminent [[Estonia]]n [[astrophysicist]] and one of the discoverers of the [[Large-scale structure of the cosmos|large-scale structure]] of the [[Universe]].{{Citation needed|date=September 2007}} Born in [[Tartu]], he attended the [[University of Tartu]], where he received the [[Doctor of Philosophy|Ph.D.]] equivalent in 1955 and a senior research doctorate in 1972. From 1952, he has worked as a scientist at the Tartu [[Observatory]] (1977–1998) Head of the Department of [[physical cosmology|Cosmology]]; in 1992-1995, he was Professor of Cosmology at the University of Tartu. For a long time, he was Head of the Division of [[Astronomy]] and [[Physics]] of the [[Estonian Academy of Sciences]] in [[Tallinn]]. Einasto is a member of the [[Academia Europaea]], the [[European Astronomical Society]] and the [[Royal Astronomical Society]]; he has received three Estonian National Science Awards. *1947 Tartu Secondary School No. 1 *1952 University of Tartu *1955 Cand.Sc. in physics and mathematics *1972 D.Sc. in physics and mathematics *1992 Professor *1991 Member of Academia Europaea *1994 Member of the Royal British Society of Astronomy The [[asteroid]] [[11577 Einasto]] discovered in 1994 is named in his honour. ==External links== *[http://www.aai.ee/~einasto/ Jaan Einasto] page at the [[Tõravere Observatory]] ==See also== *[[Vera Rubin]] - her discovery of "flat [[rotation curves]]" is the most direct and robust evidence of dark matter. {{Authority control|VIAF=88232149}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Einasto, Jaan | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = [[Estonia]]n [[astrophysicist]] | DATE OF BIRTH = 23 February 1929 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Tartu]], [[Estonia]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Einasto, Jaan}} [[Category:1929 births]] [[Category:Cosmologists]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Estonian astrophysicists]] [[Category:Estonian astronomers]] [[Category:Estonian physicists]] [[Category:Members of Academia Europaea]] [[Category:Members of the Estonian Academy of Sciences]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of the National Coat of Arms, 2nd Class]] [[Category:Hugo Treffner Gymnasium alumni]] {{Estonia-scientist-stub}} {{Europe-astronomer-stub}}
